articles.title: Joint Seminar on DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Held
articles.content:
Poster Exhibition Opens 
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- There opened an exhibition of posters calling for the implementation of the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial.
 On display are at least 40 posters including "Let's Successfully Carry Forward the Feats and Tradition of the Great Leader Who Dedicated Himself to the Cause of Army Building!" and "Let the Whole Party and Army and All the People Unite as One in Mind and More Strikingly Demonstrate the Might of Songun!" produced by the Mansudae Art Studio, "Let's Effect an Unprecedented Boost in Production Just as We Did in the Period of the Great Chollima Surge in the 1950s!" and "Let's Concentrate All Forces on Doing Farming Well!" by the Central Fine Arts Studio and "Let's Actively Encourage People in
Preparing National Food!" by Pyongyang University of Fine Arts.    
 An opening ceremony took place at the Pyongyang International Cultural Center on Monday.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause of Reunification Favored
Struggle for Japan's Settlement of Past Conducted in S. Korea
Creation of Special Investigation Committee Called for
National Preparatory Committee of India Formed
articles.content:
Creation of Special Investigation Committee Called for 
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The 63 Fellowship Society made up of the former student activists, who took part in the struggle against the signing of the "south Korea-Japan agreement", called a press conference on January 19 and called for organizing a special committee to probe the truth behind the signing of the "agreement" in the "National Assembly", according to south Korean KBS.
 The organization asserted that the special committee should call those who signed the humiliating "agreement" at that time and probe the truth. The committee should also investigate the fact that mandarins of the government requested Japanese businesses to provide a large amount of political funds to them in the course of the talks, it said.    
 The organization stressed that all other documents related to the "south Korea-Japan agreement" should be declassified and the issue of compensation to the victims of the Japanese imperialists' military occupation should be discussed once again.

articles.title: Anniversary of Ponghwa General Bureau Observed
articles.content:
National Preparatory Committee of India Formed 
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A national preparatory committee of India was formed in New Delhi on Jan. 19 with due ceremony to commemorate the Day of the Sun and the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il (February 16).
 At the ceremony Chairman of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association P. Shiv Shankar was elected chairman of the preparatory committee, Chairman of the Indian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification K. S. Rao, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the All-India Forward Bloc Debabrata Biswas, Honorary President of the World Peace Council Romesh Chandra, Director General of the International Institute of the Juche Idea Vishwanath, Member of the Political Bureau of
the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) Sitaram Yechury, Secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India D. Raja, Chairman of the All-India Freedom Fighters Organization Shashi Bushan and Secretary of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of India Abani Roy vice-chairmen of the preparatory committee and Secretary General of the Asian Regional Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification Om Prakash Mantri secretary general of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee set the period of commemoration from Jan. 20 to April 20 and decided to widely organize colorful functions such as national seminar, meeting, film show, photo exhibition, lecture and round-table talks with a view to giving wide publicity to the revolutionary life of President Kim Il Sung who performed the immortal feats for the human cause of independence and the feats of Kim Jong Il who is glorifying the era of independence with his Songun revolutionary leadership and significantly greeting the Day of the Sun and the February holiday in this period.

Greetings to Indian Prime Minister

articles.content:
Greetings to Indian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the Republic of India.
 Expressing the belief that friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would grow stronger in mutual interests, the message wished the Indian people prosperity and well-being as well as the prime minister greater success in his responsible work.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Indian counterpart K. Natwar Singh.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Indian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Ukrainian President
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Jan. 23 sent a congratulatory message to Viktor Yushchenko upon his election as president of Ukraine.
 He expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future, too.

articles.title: Korean People's Patriotic Zeal
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Indian President
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Jan. 25 sent a message of greetings to Indian President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the Republic of India.
 The message expressed the conviction that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would grow stronger in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.
